content: Investments Asked by Tan Wei Jie ShawnAsked on 18 Jun 2018What are some of the REITS that is worth investing?4 answersAnswerBump1
Answers (4)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Sandy ChamLevel 3. WonderkidAnswered on 19 Jun 2018It's hard to say. But u want those with good growth prospects. High Pe. Relative affordability and a good sponsor. Some ffil most of the criteria but they are not affordable as of yet. Also you might want to consider those of whose assets which you are familiar with or visit some of their key assets. Ie if you buy a hospitality trust. Know why their hotels are better than others. What's their moat 0 comments1

Hannah FooLevel 3. WonderkidAnswered on 18 Jun 2018I invest in those that will give high dividends. You can check out this link for the dividends
https://www.dividends.sg/rank/reit0 comments1

WonderkidAnswered on 20 Aug 2018As per my opnion on the basis of their dividend share list. these REIT's are best for the investment.AIMSAMP Cap ReitCache Log TrustEC World ReitFrasers HTrustIREIT GlobalLippo Malls TrSoilbuildBizReitAscendas ReitIf you want to check you a list of 30+ Singapore REIT, check my answer on this posthttps://seedly.sg/questions/what-are-the-key-criteria-for-evaluating-reits​0 comments0

Kenneth LouLevel 8. WizardAnswered on 19 Jun 2018Echoing what Hannah has shared, you can check out the dividend link that you see: https://www.dividends.sg/rank/reit​Or, the other way would be to go for a course to figure out how to assess REITs. May cost you between $300 - 400 for the course itself. Would recommend the DrWealth one where you get to see which fits your profile the best and/or for you to figure out how to analyse the company based on quantitative and qualitative benchmarks. ​You can also look at certain industry specific use cases at this link here: https://blog.seedly.sg/review-reits-singapore-invest/ As you see, all 39 REITs.​Cheers! 0 comments0
